There are two reasons to make a movie that are appropriate:1. To give someone an enjoyable two hours out of their lives2. For artistic purposes.This movie does neither. It's merely a way to make money off of the recent Japan craze. I didn't want to see 'The Grudge' at all, but I heard that Sam Raimi (of Evil Dead and Spiderman fame) was producing it. So I rented it and to tell you the truth, I would have rather done hard labor for eight hours for no pay than spent my precious time watching this. OH NO! A CROAKING GHOST! Sam Raimi, I'm ashamed. If you enjoy anime to the point that you own thirty zillion mangas than this is the movie for you!

Review title: Quite one of the worst movies...
Review_body: This movie, by far is the worst I have seen this year, actually, in a few years. Ninety-five minutes of complete boredom and dullness. It seemed as if it were three hours instead of its hour and a half. The plot dragged and the same thing happened over and over. It was to the point that by the third time the 'suspense' happened, you were yawning to the point of falling asleep. Besides the fact it didn't even make sense. I was trying to re-play it in my mind when it was finished, but to no avail. I have no understanding to what happened.There are very few films that have made me feel as if I wasted my money... This being one of them. My advice to you, if you really want to see it, wait till it comes out on video. At least that way, you won't have to spend as much money to just fall asleep to.

Review title: Sarah can surely kill vampires but has a problem with ghosts
Review_body: Just seen this movie this evening. Don't waste your money. A few screen flashes and some intense music, WOW, what a horror flick. I still have no clue as to what this movie was about or it's purpose. I can't say the acting was bad, and the cinematography wasn't that bad either, there was no plot. It's just a run to the mill flash flick horror.As a mature movie watcher I can see why it was rated PG-13. It's not ment for the intelligent movie watchers. More for the simple minded.My two cents,Disappointed

This movie is as scary as "The A Team" and just as well scripted.The last Japanese to American remake film I watched was The Ring, which was far superior to this effort (made by the same people I think?). It had many plot similarities, included the last but one scene especially, but I enjoyed The Ring and hated this. The plot itself was pretty thoughtless and was probably knocked together on the back of a knapkin in a school canteen. Geller's acting was sufficient, as was everyone else's, but that could not save this dire and predictable dross from falling flat on its face.I wouldn't recommend this film to anyone over the age of 12, there's just nothing to it.2/10.

Review title: god this movie is so unoriginal!
Review_body: they just copied a bunch of sh*t from The Ring, added a couple of creepy nonsense things and tried to put in "japanse flavor" by sticking in it a tall house with a funky roof and a huge garden. yeah, not scary. bad mystery/investigation elements, not-even-close-to-scary jump moments, lazy actors. this really sucked. seriously, go watch The Ring. THATS a good movie. but please...don't try to copy it and end up with a butchered film about a girl who crawls down stairs funky. seriously the whole camera thing? uhuh, no! LEAVE CRAWLING OUT OF THE TV TO SAMARA!!! and what the heck was with the cat getting drowned to? they never explained that. why would the dad drown the cat...? that was just stupid. and the special effects were horrible. get a new makeup job. and SMG is not the greatest actress. she just looks through people and it's ANNOYING. GO TAKE LESSONS, CHRISSAKES! there was no Japanese flavor in this either since its not like centered around japan and the director was bad to begin with. if you liked the Grudge then please...don't' hate...and why are you reading this anyways?

I actually liked the movie. It freaked me out. They took advantages of cliché's, but made them interesting and surprising. Scenes with bathtubs of water and and creepy stairways are used almost too often in movies, but I really think they made good use of them. Even though we know there is a scare coming, the movie never ceases to startle me. They also did a good job on creating faces and moments that are unforgettable. I was sucked into the movie and walked along side Karen as she desperately tried to understand what was happening and feared for her life. I can't wait to see The Grudge 2. I am anxious to see the terrifying story continue and unfold.

Finally got around to seeing the movie, and I thought it was fairly decent. Definitely more creepy than scary, but anyway, I wanted to start a discussion to see what everyone thought about certain aspects of the story line that I am still pondering (**These questions will contain plot spoilers**) -Why did Toshio talk to Rachel? It was the only time in the whole movie he actually said something, so why did he decide to watch her from the stairs and answer her question about who he was? -Is Toshio protecting Rachel? For several characters, Toshio went right after them, but he didn't with Karen. Then at the end of the movie, Karen gets to see the whole flashback about what happened to the family, and I got the impression that Toshio was the one showing it to her, since he looks right at her during it. Then it's Toshio's mother that comes after Karen, not Toshio.

I think that this movie was quite scary. I think it could of been better and a little less confusing but I enjoyed it. I twas given to me but I lost it so I had to download it of Limewire Pro. I would of seen it in the Movies but it is a 15 rating, so I wasn't old enough. Overall I think it was good. A lot of people have said to me that it was extremely difficult to understand. I found that out at first, but after watching it a few times, ( 5 or 6 times! ) I finally got the hang of it. I can't wait to see The grudge 2!!! I think that it will be a lot better than the first ( Looking at the trailer ). I don't know what rating is yet so I don't know if I would be let in if I went to watch it in at the Movies.

I remember watching this at the cinema when it came out & thinking it was scary, but just re-watched it & it's pretty terrible, there's no tension, no scare jumps,.it's literally two people in really white makeup.

I was coaxed into seeing this film by my brother, and my expectations were not high. Even so, they were not met. We were treated to a rehash of several horror movies, including the far superior Ringu. The biggest fault of this film is that it's only means of raising suspense is to build up the music to a crescendo, after which the audience is treated to a quick surprise, like so many weak slasher flicks of the late 90s. The characters lack any sort of depth, with no back stories or motivations what so ever, and the acting is weak at best, especially from leading lady Sarah Michelle Gellar, no surprise there. Bottom line, avoid this stinker at all costs.* star out of *****

I Have seen this movie before. But I had not paid any attention to it whatsoever. Today I decided to watch it. After Hiring it, I turned on my DVD player. I sat there for the first part, that was the "only" part which made me scream. After seeing the grudge face a couple of times, i thought, "My gosh, this is not "horror." I sat there for over an hour thinking this movie is so boring. The ending was even worse. I am so glad I have not seen the Grudge 2, I Reckon it will be worse than the first one. I would not classify this movie as 'horror' I'd classify it as "Crap." There should be more blood & guts for 'horror' movies. And more action that leaves you with a Cliff-hanger most of the time. Not just sitting there waiting for it to end. The best Horror Movie I saw, was "Without Warning."(in the 70's-80's) That alien's face still haunts me everyday. If any of you would like to see the grudge, Just know that it is a waste of time and there is poor horror included.

If you're looking for even the slightest bit of originality, prepare yourself for disappointment. When the movie first begins, tantalizing "clues" materialize to what might be behind the dark events of the house around which the story centers, only to be ultimately meaningless excuses for a cheap scare or utterly obvious. The Grudge is no more than a typical haunted house story and adds nothing whatsoever to the genre, in much the same manner as Stephen King's Rose Red miniseries did not live up to its full potential. Beware of comparisons to The Ring, a much more compelling and original thriller. Kudos to the production staff who give the movie a consistently dark and spooky tone even during broad daylight, however it's too bad there wasn't substance to back up the visuals. There is also the matter of Sarah Michelle Gellar's performance, which demonstrates the very small range she has as an actress and how short-lived her career will be when her beauty fades. "Karen" is virtually indistinguishable from "Buffy" (a show of which I happen to be a huge fan) except for Buffy would have kicked the ghost's ass.Ultimately, I am still waiting for someone to take the haunted house concept in a new direction. Someone let me know when they do.

It's great to see a Japanese horror movie remake actually kept in Japan. Though the protagonists are now gaijin in Tokyo I believe the story is more or less faithful to the original. (It should be since the same director made it.) The movie wasn't as scary as it was suspenseful. They didn't use gratuitous violence and special effects which was nice. Just good old-fashioned horror craft, adeptly using the viewer's imagination to fill in the blanks. I liked it better than the American Ring but that could be partially because I liked the Japanese setting. Some of the illogical things I didn't care for (like if a curse exists in a place, how can it show up halfway across Tokyo?) but I feel that way about just about any movie.

Just in time for the Halloween season, a movie reveals itself that is actually suspenseful, and not just gory. Adios to the Chuckys, Jason's, and Mike Myers - The Grudge actually will creep you out. I work at a movie theater and screened this with one other person at 1:00 in the morning. That really helped to set the mood. Aside from the great and numerous jump out of your seat scares, the plot is actually somewhat thick. The bad news is that it is a challenge to keep track of what is happening now, and what happened in the past. The good news is that it is a challenge to keep track of what is happening now, and what happened in the past. This isn't your typical psycho-killer-chasing-the-girl type movie. There are numerous key characters that you have to keep track of. This movie stimulates the brain, and the adrenaline gland. As stated in other comments, a little closure at the end of the movie would have been nice; but overall-hats off to the creators of The Grudge.

At least that's what occurred when I went to see The Grudge in theaters.While it may not be highly praised by the majority of film critics, I still thought it was well worth going to the movie theater for. The house was extremely creepy, and the way the ghosts moved gave me the shivers. I must admit that often the story line was predictable, yet I still screamed because the ghosts were really scary/creepy.I still get creeped out when I'm alone in the dark and think about those ghosts, and the way they moved. It was that slow slither yet sudden jerking that the little girl in the Ring did.

I do not care for horror but my sister convinced me to watch it. I hated it but gave it ten for anyone who likes horror. Altogether, nice job Sam.I just hated that sound Kayako made and probably everyone does. I had nightmares for weeks! The PG-13 rating was not enough. All in all, good film. Not much else to say except do not watch unless you like horror. It was better than the ring because it even said so on the box. Every time I see an Asian person I think they are jaw less. too scary for me. Toshio is really scary to me and so is Kayako. Come on, pulling someone under the bedsheets? That was supposed to be security from monsters! What really was scary about it was when that one woman was on the apartment complex and Kayako was after her. One just knew that guard would suddenly be pulled int a room and not come back out again.

I thought the Grudge was a very good film. Japanese horror movies are the only real horror movies made today. American films have started to concentrate too much on gimmicks and gore, and not enough on using suspense to shock the audience. I know the entire theater was jumping during the Grudge and that's about as much as you can ask for from a horror movie. I thought using the original Japanese director and not Americanizing the film kept it true to its roots in Japanese culture. The special effects were believable and the sets were magnificent. I liked the use on non-linear time in the movie to help give background into what was happening without revealing too much of the story too early in the picture.

While it may take some knocks for being derivative of that other Japanese remake, 'The Grudge' actually manages more chills thanks primarily to a much simpler plot. At its core, 'The Grudge' is a haunted house flick. The beauty of it, however, is that it avoids the typical haunted house plot lapse: If the house is haunted, why not leave it? 'The Grudge' posits that anyone who enters the doors becomes cursed by the fury that inhabits the home -- a curse happy to follow you back to your house, work, elevator, car. While there are a few campy conventions -- is anyone really going to venture into an attic oozing with the sounds of thuds and moans with only a lighter to illuminate the way? -- the film, for the most part, works like a charm. Quite a haunted charm at that.

Review title: Given another hour it could have been better...
Review_body: This film had potential. I did not expect it to live up to 'The Ring' but I did expect it to be scary. It started off strong but then died. The ending not only left room for a sequel which I hope would be a lot better (more elaborate) but it seemed too intentional as if it was only setting up for a sequel if you catch my drift. I think had another hour been given to the film to elaborate upon the story and the characters it would have been a lot scarier. The film also left a lot to be desired and too many questions left unanswered with those all too unfamiliar with the non-pop part of Japanese culture, such as the spiritual importance to the film, along with the concept of collectivism in the culture.I do plan on seeing Ju-on: The Grudge (the original Japanese version) and I hope it is better than this American version. As for the story behind it, it was wonderful.

Review title: "The whole time I was in that house I felt something was wrong."
Review_body: Hi. I live in Tokyo, and I just went to see The Juon at a cinema in Ikebukuro.As a horror fan who is aware of and disappointed by the fact that 95% of horror films are pure and utter shite, I am constantly on the lookout for a decent, full-blooded, and - damn it - scary, horror flick. The Juon is it. At last, another gem to prove that horror is not dead and will continue to shamble on zombie-like producing the occasional spine-chilling shocker which makes the wait worth it.It may be true that there are some cultural factors involved (which might explain the negative reviews from some of our western friends in the discussion boards), and I will readily admit that perhaps it had such a big impact on me because I could relate to so much of it.I mean, the interior of the house looks exactly like my apartment; tatami floors, sliding doors and closets, and so on; the Tokyo scenes were all familiar; the freaky wild-cats-in-heat noises that sound like babies from hell all over the city during mating season; I know what it feels like to be a fish-out-of-water gaijin in Japan (I'm Irish) and like Bill Pulman's character I am an English teacher.Without wishing to create any spoilers for those who haven't seen it, I'm sure those who have will appreciate why I was suitably freaked out.There is often terror to be found in the familiar (just ask Stephen King), so perhaps it was a little too unfamiliar for western audiences.Also, people complain that they can't understand this or that, and demand explanations. In Japanese horror, it is the understated, the inexplicable, the unknown, that makes it scary. The same thing happened with The Ring. People wanted explanations for everything: who is Sadako? What motivates her? A lot of these questions were addressed in the American remake, with the result that the clarified story was too ridiculous and unbelievable. Basically, they tried to explain too much.On the other hand, it should be borne in mind that a lot of the negative reviews (saying it's not scary, etc.) are referring to the American version of the movie only. If you check out the "trivia" section in the menu on the left of this IMDb page, you'll find that the movie was released cut after American test screen audiences viewed it, presumably because it was too scary.Can't have that now, a scary horror movie. I know, I know. I'm scratching my head too.If you're a horror fan, do yourself a favour and try to get a hold of the uncut Japanese version (ie; the real movie). I'm not sure, but it might crop up on DVD. Now that is what scary is all about.Forget 'Freddy vs Jason', or 'Jason goes to Space' or whatever. I give The Juon 10 out of 10.

Review title: THE WORST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN
Review_body: This has to have been the worst movie I have ever seen. The audience and I walked out after grumbling and cursing. WTF!!! No point! No Plot! Extremely Choppy!! In the beginning it teases you. I thought give it a chance maybe it's slow to get to the point! Nope not slow. No point to be had! As the Police Inspector says in the movie " You see it and you die! Sorry!" Huh? And what is with that stupid sound? It was as if the director took all cuts of the movie and placed them on the floor then randomly put them together. Come on people, I am gonna need you to work a little harder on the creative writing and story telling! I called everyone I know to warn them to not waste their money on this piece of crap! My boyfriend had to hear how bad it was twice. He heard it from me and again from a co-worker. He laughed because we both said the same thing. I wasted my money on that! DAMN-IT! aaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh (<---stupid funky sound that chick makes)

Review title: Jason Behr: In "the Grudge" was Hot! and a sure bet.
Review_body: My friend & I went to see it Saturday Morning 10/23. (We also got the matinée price)In the first scene with Jason (aka Doug) & Sarah (aka Karen) was the highlight of the movie (Jason in boxers & t-shirt). In the original movie, Jason's character wasn't added, so that was a plus in this movie. We are long time fans of Jason Behr (we watched everything he's in). We are also Buffy fans. This movie was very scary, but every time a Jason scene would come on we were relaxed (also the scene that were in the interviews & trailers). True that Jason (Doug) wasn't in many scenes, but the ones that he was in; he played a very strong character; who held his own ground. This was Jason's main starring male lead since Roswell ended. We are very very disappointed in the ending (For those Jason Behr Fans when you go see this movie you'll know why).We rate this movie as the following: R instead of PG-13 //// 10 Stars for Jason's wardrobe & character //// 4 1/2 Stars for Sarah (Buffy would have kicked that ghostly ass back to hell) //// A single star for rest of the cast (but Bill gets a half of star because of his short opening) //// and 2 thumbs up for the DirectorIn conclusion, we learned a lot of Japanese words. Always see this movie with a friend or a group of people. And the only reason we went to see this movie is two words (JASON BEHR!!!!)

Wow. This movie is actually scary. I have never screamed in a scary movie until now and I screamed around 5 or 6 times. I also like the fact that there wasn't a lot of blood. Just a little here and there unlike in your classic horror films like scream and I know what you did last summer, Halloween etc. The movie doesn't make to much sense until the end... the whole time your just like "wtf", but at the end, everything comes together and it all makes since. Not to mention at the end, you finally realize what the movie is about. It will definitely give you the chills. Every time I lie in the bed, I look under my covers praying I want see a face... ;-). The Grudge is highly recommended by myself if you like this sort of film!

I had seen the original (Ju-on) a year or so ago, and liked it, but I'd have to say that the remake was smoother than the original, and creepier. Keeping the story in in Japan was a nice touch, preserving some of the original feel. The plot was also tweaked in a few places to make it more accessible - for instance the time travel scene in the remake was better integrated into the plot.The movie begins with the unsettling and mysterious suicide of an American professor (Bill Pullman), setting the tone and providing some background for the unfolding story.Sarah Michelle Gellar, in Japan with her boyfriend (Jason Behr) who is studying at a Japnese school, is thrust into a bizarre supernatural world when she is assigned to substitute as a caretaker for an American family, in place of the regular caretaker, a local Japanese girl who has gone missing. Devoid of any Buffy-like powers, she nevertheless copes gamely through persistence and pluck.Ryo Ishibashi, who played the ill-fated suitor in the horror film "Audition", gives a workmanlike performance as the hard-boiled cop assigned to investigate the missing persons report. He soon discovers more than he ever bargained for.As the plot develops, these and other threads slowly come together and reveal a tale of unrequited love, jealousy and murderous rage, which transforms into a deadly and persistent spirit oppressing the house where it all took place.Some ghastly and gory surprises await the viewer, as the eerie, persistent sense of foreboding, of something just very wrong, pervades every scene and builds to the final conclusion. This is a keeper - I give it a 9 out of 10.

Review title: A handful of clichés sugar-coated in plot holes galore!
Review_body: I must admit that I went into "The Grudge" having low expectations. However, after seeing the 6/10 critics average, I thought, maybe it might not be so bad after all. Boy, was I wrong. The movie lacked dialogue, that of which wasn't extremely horrid (but there wasn't much of), and the only highlights of the movie were the scenes with the wonderful Clea DuVall and the actress playing her husband's sister. The movie was too reminiscent of other "Japanese" movies/remakes--"Ringu/The Ring" "The Eye" (all of which I actually liked) --but didn't hold as much originality as they did. It just basically pulled the same tricks out of the bag--black cats, creepy boy, creepy "ring" like girl, the two-dimensional characters...and not to mention the plot holes, which I won't ruin by going into detail. I found it quite amuzing, actually, due to the fact that several people were terrified of this typically predictable flick. There were too many unnecessary characters just there to have time added on in the movie to draw out their death, more-or-less. After all, this movie only tallied at a total of 96 minutes. "Oh, we only have an 80 minute movie!" "Let's add a random character in, away from the plot of what's going on and ex him/her off after 5 minutes of scary music and what-not like we do in the rest of the film." "Good idea!" "The Grudge" just overall did not deliver, and the only thing saving this movie from getting a 1 in my book was that it defied a very sacred place most people afraid of the boogeyman/ what-not go to when in a scary situation, (which if you ever see this god-for-saken movie will see) and, of course, the appearance of Clea DuVall (13 Conversations About One Thing). I'm sorry but the girl is amazing, and this goes in the "Why did you do this movie?" category with "Ghosts of Mars." The finale/conclusion happened so fast too, I could hardly catch what was going on and when analyzed it afterwards realized that maybe it went by so fast trying to show 'images' explaining what happened so that the audience would be confused but so wrapped up in the film that they wouldn't think of it's plot holes, but it was just a build up for me that did nothing but make it worse by "not explaining all of what happened." The concept, itself, really isn't as appealing either--Someone dies, they hold a grudge, their spirit lingers and kills all who gets in it's way--isn't near as original/exciting to me as You watch a tape, seven days later you die mysteriously, or You're blind your whole life and after getting a cornea transplant are able to see ghosts--Yes "The Ring" and "The Eye" had plot holes too, but not near as many as "The Grudge." "The Ring/Ringu" was artistically innovative in its shots in a sense and had good performances, "The Eye" was even better with it's haunting illusions, terrifyingly creepy score and even very touching moments of human emotion and the path between life and death, ane the love we have for one another, but because I have to make this short- "The Grudge" was a waste of my time, money, and by the end of this movie I was holding something far beyond a grudge....2/10

This movie will scare the **** out of you. But I found it weak on plot. Its not thrilling or as exciting as you would expect from an entertaining movie. But its scary all the same. The scariest part is probably that a person carrying the rage carries it all the way long. There is no place in the world where he or she can be safe. That in my opinion is creepy. Still I won't rate this movie good, cause as I mentioned its week on plot. I found The Ring way better with respect to the thrill it provides to the audience. Scary plus thriller is a deadly combination and as good as it can get for horror movies. Having said that I would recommend watching this movie, its worth your time. Nobody should miss the sheer horror it offers.

Although S.M.Gellar only manages to produce two facial expressions in The Grudge - one being confusion, the other being surprise/fear - she doesn't really ruin the film, because it is not about her. The focus is on her supernatural buddies and they are scary as hell. By the end of the film, you're afraid to move and you realize that this one was actually much scarier than Ringu/The Ring. The other actors, like Gellar, do a horrible job (esp. her boyfriend - 'Karen, are you okÃ¡y?!'), but that's a good thing, because it's the only way to divert yourself from the terror and giggle every once in a while. What it comes down to is this: if you want to see a good movie, rent Magnolia. If you want to have a good scare, go see this one!

Review title: People go in a house for some reason. They are killed because of some dumb spirit. Everyone dies and no one can solve the problem.
Review_body: This was probably the worst movie I have EVER seen. I am not kidding. I don't like horror movies, though, so I may be a bit biased. However, I still don't understand what the point of this movie was. In the end, EVERYONE died. There was no solution to the problem, no nothing. Everyone died meaning that the story will repeate itself over and over again. There was no way for the characters not to be killed. During the movie, I was just waiting for it to end. I HATED this movie.At least, in "The ring", there was a solution to the problem, there was something to understand. Anyway, if you don't like horror movies, don't watch this one because you will definitively dislike it.

I saw this movie in a crowded theater, and it might have affected my view on it. Right now i feel it wasn't that scary, if at all, but i think if i was alone in a dark room, i would have had a heart attack.The movie its self wasn't designed to be suspenseful, if it was they did an awful job. They seem to have based it on the jump tactic- having sudden things happen at calm, unsuspicious times. The other thing they did was they added some gore, but it wasn't violent they just showed some gruesome sights, these scenes were kind of creepy but not enough to make your heart race. The other not so good part of the movie was that the ghost was very unrealistic, it looked very animated. I myself feel this movie wasn't very scary but if you are an amiture then it is a good place to start before jumping into truly scary movies, but if your not easily phased then i would skip this one if u crave a true scare, but if you aren't in the mood for a really scary movie then go and give it a shot.

Review title: The plot and opinion of THE GRUDGE
Review_body: I'm a great horror movie fan. To me THE GRUDGE 2 was the best!!! I think the grudge was spawned from the RING/RING U series!!! The whole movie is confusing and partially bore-some. BUT, it is extremely creepy and dark as well!!! Kayoko herself is very terrifying!!! And the story of how Kayoko died may be disturbing to many people.The plot of the story is simply that there's a mysterious curse that comes upon people who dares enter her house. A woman named Karen finds a job that requires her to take care of a woman. The woman's caretaker arrives at the cursed house. The house is trashed and....... NOT TO GIVE AWAY ANY SPOILERS NEAR THE BEGINNING IF THE MOVIE A WOMAN IS KILLED, LEAVING HER DISABLED MOTHER ON HER OWN. Throughout the house you'll see eerie figures and might experience supernatural encounters!!!

Review title: Disappointing.. If it wasn't so darn scary!
Review_body: I saw this movie and I had no idea what to expect. I hadnt seen any Japanese versions or hadnt even seen a trailer for this movie. So of course, I entered the cinema in anticipation of it being just your average horror movie, based on the fact that Sarah Michelle Gellar plays the starring role :P.I was pleasantly surprised. I am a lover of horror movies and its a rare case that I am scared during a horror movie but this film truly scared me to the point that at times I was praying in my head that the person currently in the house wouldn't go and enter the room with the cupboard in it and I even found myself looking away at times when you get the music build up. It was really that scary for me and the mean croaking noise is nothing short of haunting lol, the noise just makes it so much more spooky.The storyline can be confusing if you aren't paying attention but I found it pretty easy to follow, even after some confusion when Sarah Michelle Gellar is watching the other man's story of being in the house as if she was walking round the house aswel (if you haven't seen it yet then and you are going to then you will see what I mean).Overall it is quite a good movie and worth seeing, as it is so scary. I left the movie and said to my girlfriend that I never want to see that movie again ever, not even on DVD because that noise just spooked me out to much and what would you know it, 2 days later (tonight) I am going to see the movie again with a friend lol. I just watched the trailer of the movie and now I am very nervous hehe, even after seeing the actual movie :P10/10 for just how scary it was for me (you personally may not get scared by the same things as me though in all honesty) and 7/10 for the interesting story, even after the unsatisfying ending.

I went to see this film on my birthday with my girlfriends on 17/11/04. I had wanted to go see it since i saw it on TV.I had a rough idea of the plot but nothing definite. From the moment Bill Pullman fell over the building i knew it was going to be a good film. At the first scary part with the cat...all of my friends jumped, including me. From then onwards we were hiding behind each other and squeaking. I was told it was the scariest film of the 21st century. Thats correct. Its the scariest film i've seen so far and i've seen quite a lot of films. Unlike most scary films, this actually has a plot that makes sense. It becomes clear though only at the end. Its a brilliant film, brilliant music, camera work, tension building and brilliant plot. I love japanesse films, and this is definitely one of them.

I've had some friends of mine argue that the Japanese version of the Ring (Ringu, I think) was much better to the two that have been made here. I loved the Grudge, I thought it was terrifying (although I couldn't keep from thinking of Sarah Michelle Geller as Buffy...). In this movie, I actually screamed, and I have never screamed in a movie theater in my life. I actually had claw marks from my best friend grabbing my arm in the middle of the movie. If you've seen it, you know it tends to have that kind of effect when you watch it for the first time. But I've heard that the Japanese version is better...is this true?

I was kinda psyched up by others, they said it was the most creepy movie EVER. BUT NO. I didn't even get shocked once. I found it funny how they tried to. tell a story about at house that will get you killed. and where is the plot?? all there is to it, is that when you have been inside the house, you die.Although the footage is really good. the pictures are beautiful. the sounds where the only things in this movie, which where a bit scary.And there have been made to many Japan Horror/scary movies. Come on Writers get some new ideas. I am tired of the some old wet ghost.But don't listen to my judgments see it yourself

As it seems my comment will be at the end of perhaps a few thousand, I doubt it will be read - but I need to vent.I love films which scare me to the core. This was not one of those films. Ordinarily I may have been able to enjoy it anyway, but the thing that drives me creeping up the wall like one of those crazy grey devil people is that this film was billed as being similar to The Ring. Now _that's_ a film that chilled my _soul._ And yes, I'm referring to the American remake of Ringu.For me, scares are about nasty surprises that kick in a fight/flight reflex. I'm comfortable in my assumption that there's no spider sitting next to me on my desk, so when I find that there _is,_ I jump. Just how much I jump seems to depend on how confident I am in my assumption. If I expect a spider to be there I'll be wary, but not as shaken when I see it.The same principle applies to films that I see. I'm always going to jump if a ghostly white face suddenly appears in a bus window. Or little scary grey spirits appear sitting idly in the corner of a room. The Grudge relies almost wholly on these cheap jumps - and after a while, once my nerves were shot, they became almost boring. Once I'm out of the theatre, however, I won't think about it again. There's no lasting feel of _dread._ So we get back to the comparison with The Ring and why that irritates me so much.The Ring was a textbook example on how to scare the pants of someone, and keep scaring them long after they've gone home. Perhaps some of this has to do with the fact that I went in expecting to see a formula Hollywood scary movie, but whatever. That film uses most of it's time slot preparing the audience for one brilliant fright. It winds us up, gets us scared using all the little devices, lets us think it's wound down and that the spirits are happy. Then little Aiden wants to know why his mummy let the ghost out of the well. "You weren't supposed to do that, Rachel." It's one line delivered by a small child in the light of day - and yet no film since has been able to terrify me as much.That said, one scene of The Grudge I really did like was the one with Susan in the elevator. The little kid Toshio appearing in the window on each floor without her noticing was tres creepy.Okay, enough.

I went into this movie wanting to see a scary movie and for the most part thats what i got.Most people writing things about this movie talk about it like it was supp to be some big Oscar winning "Schendler's list" type of picture and missed the point. And i think the only real prob i did have with it was that there wasn't much in the way of lines spoken in the movie, and haven't yet to see the movie that this was remade from I'm just takin maybe there wasn't a lot of lines spoken in that.. but it does add to the surrealness of the hole thing.but overall it was just what it was supp to be a scary movie. i came out of the movie happy and still talking about it. And i will be seeing it again.. so hey guys lightin up and just have fun

I didn't expect much but was I wrong. I can only say that it is a very good horror movie. Maybe the storyline was too thin and could have been spread out better over the movie, but there are lots of great effects and the acting is good, although Bill Pullman doesn't do a lot of acting in the movie. Sarah Michelle Gellar did a great job; I didn't once see her as Buffy. The obscure Japanese setting really works in this movie. It gives a great atmosphere to the movie If you liked the Ring and Dark Water, you must see this one. Actually the effects are better than in The Ring; the story though isn't. I can't wait to see the sequel The Grudge 2 (also Sam Raimi as exec.producer).

you will know exactly when a scary part is coming up. That being said, this movie is quite predictable as to when the scary parts will be coming next. Example: when someone walks into a room you immediately think, "Oh, that door is going to shut." Guess what happens? The door shuts.The story behind the house is pretty twisted with the film. What I mean by that is the movie jumps around from different times and leaves you wondering if it's in the present or a flashback.The ending is just a let down. If you feel like jumping and being a little creeped out, go see it, but if not, avoid it.

There was less happening than in "The Happening". Congratulations, movie.Oh, there are ten lines required (I wish this was the case for the script...). So, there you go: Sarah Michelle Gellar is walking around. Slowly. Then, she's walking around a tad slower. Also, there are exciting subplots. All of them involve somebody walking around slowly. And there's a bathtub. And a ghost.Damnit, even the extras are bored (watch the bus scene where the one guy looks at his watch. Priceless!).One a more positive note, Bill Pullman commits suicide. Therefore, 3 out of 10.

Review title: Scary, don't you tell me it isn't
Review_body: Alright, let's be honest, shall we? The movie does not have a good script, actually it doesn't even have a script, but you have to be done of steel not to feel fear in very many scenes. I think this movie it's OK, the goal of it was to make viewer be scared, and it carried out it. Sometime you realize the film doesn't take you anywhere, it has nothing to say, it is all about a ghost's apparition, which truly scares you and makes you jump from your seat. If you ask me, you may want to see this movie because it will give you one and half hour of pure horror. If you want that from one movie, you'd better watch it. If you are looking for something else, just read a book

Review title: Almost meaningless mixed salad of "scary" elements
Review_body: Difficult to call The Grudge a horror movie. At best it made me slightly jump from surprise at a couple of moments.If one forgets the (failed) frightening dimension and looks at other sides of the movie, he is again disappointed. The acting is OK but not great. The story can be somewhat interesting at the beginning, while one is trying to get what's happening. But toward the end one understands there is not much to understand. "Scary" elements seems sometimes to have been added to the script without reason...So... (yawn) See this movie it if you have nothing more interesting to do, like cutting the carrots or looking at the clouds.

Review title: Death stares Sarah Michelle Gellar in the eyes..
Review_body: "The Grudge" is another movie where people watch a videotape and, because of an unforgiving spirit, all die pretty much identical deaths in the film. This time it's a haunted house in Japan. The film begins with a home nurse riding her bike, taking a brake from a sick woman named Emma she's being paid to care of. When she goes back into Emma's home, she's startled by loud noises in the attic, noises that are too large and deliberate to be an animal. She checks it out anyways.Expecting to find a serial killer or burglar hiding in the attic, she finds something much worse. After her boss can't get a hold of her the next day, he talks an exchange student named Karen (Sarah Michelle Gellar) into substituting for the "missing" nurse. Gellar has a bad feeling about this, but agrees to go.As we first see the outside of the house, there's lots shots of Karen reacting nervously to it as she walks up to the door. But it's not a scary house. Besides the black clouds hovering over it, it looks like a nice place.After Karen goes inside to find Emma on the floor, kicking incoherently, she puts her back to bed and starts cleaning up the dump. Emma isn't responsive to Karen and just stares at her. Even after staring, she stares some more.The attic starts making noises again. Karen goes to check it out. She finds a creepy little boy and his cat in a closet locked with maybe 50 yards of tape.. left or (placed)inside the closet is a mysterious journal that, later on in the film, just might help Karen figure what's going on and what it all means. The boy, like Emma, doesn't really talk, but acts creepy and stares. He stares just like Emma. Karen is no match for their staring.So we go into long flashbacks, where Emma and her family first visit the house to consider buying it. Emma checks out the attic first, while the family talks with the realtor. Emma's daughter comes up and finds her gazing non-responsively at the wall at something we can't see. After the rest of the family tries to snap her out of it, and fails, her son goes down to tell the realtor "we'll take it." Like I said, it's a nice place.A few days later Emma's daughter finds a cat on the staircase, that isn't hers'. Wouldn't that be weird if you found a cat in your house that wasn't yours'? Then a pair of ghostly arms grab that cat and runs into the attic. Emma's daughter, scared, goes to into the attic to check it out. The door shuts behind her.There's a scene where Karen (Gellar) goes to check on Emma and the ghost, for the first time, manifests itself to Karen, hovering above her with what looks like 50 yards of hair floating around the room. Karen is so traumatized by what she's seen she's taken to the hospital where she's later asked by her boyfriend, "What happened?"... Karen sort of looks at the ground and shakes her head, "It's that house. There's just something in there." So I guess now that Karen has figured out there's something strange in the house, she looks up old newspaper articles and discovers something sinister about the houses' history. 3 years ago, there were 3 deaths including a cat. But another man also killed himself the very next morning. A man that lives close by. This man looks familiar, he's in the journal that was placed in the closet. This eventually leads Karen to other places and things that explain why the house is haunted and why people are dying.Is this movie scary? If it is, it's in the scenes that use long silences that build tension, and loud, scary noises that make us jump by abruptly breaking those long silences. It's effective, but it feels like an exercise. I didn't care about what was going to happen, but rather when it was going to happen.One of the reasons Chinese water torture is so effective has to do with gaps of time prisoners endure while suffering the excruciating feeling of wondering when the next drop will come. I don't say this to draw a literal comparison between Chinese water torture and the quality of the Grudge. But here are, after all, a lot of Japanese people in this film that look Chinese... and are often drowned.-nyquil_addict

This has GOT to be one of the worst movies I've ever seen. I was completely bored and even found myself laughing at times over the stupidity of this movie. The ending was horrible, the plot left much to be desired and the acting wasn't all that great either. I was more entertained by the 12-year-old girl sitting in front of me jumping, screaming and clinging to her boyfriend throughout the movie. I would NOT recommend this movie to ANYONE...ever. I am someone who is easily scared by movies but this movie was not even close to being scary. I want my $8 back!!

Review title: at least it was worth my money Spoiler!
Review_body: this movie was not bad. i had to keep my hand over my mouth to not scream a couple of times. The ending could've been better. Many parts of the movies were scarier than others, and the beginning was sort of confusing. The thing it most reminded me of was darkness falls meets The Ring. One thing I didn't like about this movie was (SPOILERS AHEAD) that if they knew the curse was in that house, why not destroy it? I mean the one cop tried that one time but he didn't have to go inside the house to set it on fire.. that could of been done outside too. Good movie to take the family Halloween weekend. I give it a 7 out of 10. Can't wait till it hits DVD. desiree.

I was never a huge fan of Ju-On, but I decided to give The Grudge a chance because I was at least into the atmosphere of the original. The Grudge, while spooky at times and with a few worthwhile jump-out scares, isn't really anything special. It seemed to be a bit too ambitious for its own good. While some films like Fight Club or Memento managed to pull off bizarre timelines without a hitch and gain critical acclaim, The Grudge attempted and failed to tell a non-linear story. The result was a mess of vignettes that were connected only by the same house and central theme.I would have rated this film much higher if it were possible to even try to follow. It defies conventional horror tropes pretty well and does a good job at straddling the border between American and Japanese horror. The fact that it was basically Ju-On but with white people and a lot more confusing was somewhat laughable, though.Overall, it was an incredibly ambitious attempt that didn't do much for me. I'm a huge horror fan but the fact that it was nearly impossible to follow the storyline and I just couldn't relate or bond with any of the characters, so there was very little emotion when someone died.I'd suggest skipping this one and trying something like the similar film The Ring or the Chinese horror film The Eye. This film and the original just don't really go anywhere exciting.

Review title: Worst cliché horror film ever made.
Review_body: Wow...absolutely the worst film ever! It fits the exact cliché of all of the other lame horror films coming out today such as "The Ring" and "Darkness Falls." All of the same story lines, same color filters, same lame acting, etc. I saw it and thank goodness I did not pay, since I snuck in to see it, with the awful judgment of listening to my friends. So many people paid to see this film, and that was way scarier than anything in the film itself. So many people paying to see this film is the reason why Hollywood puts out as many wasted garbage films as it does. I can't understand how anyone can look at these films and think to themselves, "Wow that was so great and it's gonna be remembered forever in film history!" I hope they all take a second thought and waste their money on something else, instead of supporting these atrocities.

THE RING v THE GRUDGE..........THE GRUDGE IS MUCH BETTERits one to see, it really is. The horror is very well done, its much darker and deeper than any other horror i have seen. Lots of JUMPY parts, the atmosphere is flawless. Sarah Michelle Gellar is very good in her role as a American nurse working in a "crused" house in japan. She finds her self at the mercy of forces beyond her control when she discovers the the secrets and the chilling past of the family who lived there, and who ever enters...will do so to their on peril! When "odd" and yet "terrifying" little boy is found in a closet.....then thats when everything goes wrong....People call this THE RING knockoff, but this is far from the truth THE GRUDGE is much better and made before the ring was ever made.9 outa 10 It really is worth seeing, i bet you, you will jump more than 3 times watching this film. If you want a great horror, go see this.

Review title: Better than recent PG-13 horror films
Review_body: This movie isn't as horrible as everyone makes it out to be. Sure "The Ring" was much better but that's still not saying a whole lot either. I actually enjoyed this film it had its creepy moments, but wasn't as scary as I expected. Also it got a little bit too repetitive by the end. I just wish that directors could go back to making horror films the way that they used to. Begin by aiming for that R rating, most true horror fans enjoy gore, nudity, and language the three elements missing from this new breed of watered down PG-13 horror film. This movie is worth a rental if you're a horror fan looking for something to tide you over until the next quality R rated horror film is released.

I really enjoyed The Grudge. The movie was directed by a Japanese man and I enjoyed his style of directing. Sometimes something would pop out when you least expected it. Sarah Michelle Gellar is an excellent actress and she plays a very convincing role. The scary characters{dead people} in the movie have brilliant detail to their horrifying looks. On the negative side their is no blood or gore in the movie. Some movie critics will think that the movie is not scary because it is bloodless. but do not listen to them the is a very suspenseful movie and it will send chills up your spine the the first twenty minutes of the film. I gave this film a 9/10 and I encourage everyone to get up and go see it.

I thought that the grudge was the best pg-13 movie that i have seen in a long time. There was some scary parts that made me jump i think that everyone should rate this movie the best. I think that Sarah Michelle Gellar did an excellent performance in this movie. There could have been a little bit more scary part but there was a good story behind this and i hope that the producer could come out with another grudge and maybe this one would get a better rating on it. Some of my friends thought that this movie sucked b/c they didn't find it scary enough so they left in the middle of the movie. I think that all the people that enjoyed the movie should vote the let the world know that this wasn't a bad movie and it was made for the whole family to see it.

What do you get when you combine The Ring and Nightmare on Elm Street I don't know but this mess comes close. Personally i wasn't scared once throughout this entire film. I originially assumed this to be a mental thriller but instead it turned out to be a bunch of cheap boo type scares. I really expected to walk away feeling good about the movie but I honestly just wasn't impressed. Sarah Michelle Gellar tried her best to carry this movie but honestly there was just no hope. It had potential but just didn't make it unfortunately. I had a good story but the combination of poor acting with a semi decent plot there was just no good chemistry at all within the film. It's good for a group of highschoolers/ middle schoolers but as an adult I don't think you'll be impressed. I see it as a great film for the kids but nothing impressive for anyone else.

Review title: A tired story pushed with poor acting and predictable scares.
Review_body: Sarah Michelle Geller is horrible in this movie. As is the director. Why do movie directors feel the need to end horror movies with some sort of last scare? It's not scary anymore because it is so predictable and in the case of this movie it doesn't even make sense. It feels tacked on for no reason - which it is.The middle of this movie delivers some real scares, but not enough to make this worth watching. Don't waste your time or rental money.SIDE NOTE: In the special features section of the DVD Sarah M. Geller talks about how the house in the movie is another 'character' in the film. No it's not. And I am sick and tired of hearing people say that about movies. If anything has some type of importance to a film (like a soundtrack or a set) people call it another character!

Review title: Potentially a scary movie, but ruined by advertising
Review_body: My biggest complaint of the movie actually doesn't come from the movie, it comes from the advertising. Nearly all of the incredible scenes from the movie are given away in the trailers. I am not exaggerating either. On its own merit, The Grudge is a 7,8/10 film. Plot is generally non-existent, and it is all about the scares. Unfortunately, the morons behind production and advertising decided to ruin the one reason you'd have for going to see the movie.If you haven't seen that many previews, you'll definitely enjoy the movie more. Just keep in mind that plot is really not there. (That isn't necessarily a bad thing; the movie doesn't need some complex plot, so it doesn't have one. A quarter of the way through the movie, the entire plan of the movie should be spelled out for you. As long as you aren't expecting a plot like The Ring, in terms of complexity/depth, then the Grudge's lack of plot shouldn't bother you too much).

Review title: I wont be sleeping for weeks to come!!
Review_body: I'm even afraid to leave my computer; I look behind me every 10 seconds. OK, the movie scared the living crap out of me. I knew that this movie was going to be scary, but when your sitting there, eating popcorn, and not knowing what comes up...it comes up!!(if you know what I mean). Personally, I'm a huge horror fan, there's a lot of movies that scare me to death, but then the night of the Grudge. No other movie in my opinion can reach such a spooky, disturbing, fightening, terrifying, creepy atmospheric level. If you haven't seen this movie yet, and you've seen The Ring and thought that was the scariest movie, see The Grudge, you will pee your pants until it leaks through. I give this movie a 10/10. I know that sounds like really crazy, but I thought the movie was really good and creepy that I really really like it. A definite Top 10 for my favorite scary movies. I recommend this movie no less than the age of 11, anyone under will like seriously have nightmares. But it's only my advice, so whatever...The Grudge is an awesome movie. GO SEE IT!!!

I loved the Grudge. It was nice and creepy and not all about slashers and blood. It was more of an intelligent scary movie, with subtle scares, kind of like in the 6th Sense. And SMG was great, breaking away from Buffy and showing utter terror on her face without having to scream (anyone can scream). I highly recommend it, although, try and go either real late or real early,I had way too many teenagers in the theater acting like asses, and screwing up the scary parts. I will certainly go see it again before it leaves the theaters! I am a Buffy fanatic, but it was nice to SMG do something else. Like in Cruel Intentions, she showed her power as an actress, and all those people that don't think she's a GOOD actress, see The Grudge. Creepy, scary, good plot, all around good movie!!!

Review title: makes The Ring look like Shrek 2!
Review_body: watched this film yesterday at the cinema... only wish i had bought some spare underpants!!it is one of the scariest/shocking movies out...it has a reasonably good story with not too many holes in it... and it ends well...i haven't seen the original version, needless to say i'm sure people will say it's better and scarier, but lets face it o-one going to watch that at the cinema are they!highly recommended...SADif.co.uk

Review title: That woman's face and child stays in your head...
Review_body: This movie scared the hell out of me. That woman's face and that child are still in my head. Every time I'm alone, I feel like that boy is just going to pop up and meow. The story line is horrible, definitely could've been written a lot better. I was not sure how I felt about the story behind the house and the family that used to leave there. I would've definitely written it differently. Maybe a bit more dramatic and sympathetic to the wife and child. But if you want to be scared out of your wits, this is the movie to see...They tried to do a Buffy thing towards the end, that was a bit too much. And if you are Jason B. fan, he looks really great in this film. Love the hair!

I just went to the premiere, and I went in thinking: "Oh god, this is the ring. They've even got the woman with the hair."Well. I highly recommend it, I haven't seen the Japanese version, but It'll probably ruin my life too. Everything is eerie, the crowd reactions were great. It was really fun. I enjoyed it a lot. I don't want to give anything away, but I liked the ending... and I liked everything about the movie. I had no unanswered questions.Everything was hunky dory except for my screaming, and "OH GOD" and "JESUS CHRIST'S" and "AHHH."This is my first comment, so be gentle. :(

The Grudge staring former scream queen, Sarah Michelle Gellar,(scream 2, I know what you did last summer and Buffy the vampire slayer) stars in the great horror masterpiece. Sarah is my obsession! and i cant wait for the sequel! the movies plot is good but not weak, and it has a ton of disturbing images that had viewers screaming. The croaking noise Kayoko maid, had people laughing, but when we saw her face every one screamed! The Grudge was WAY better than The Ring and MUCH scarier, since the ring had one jumpy 2 second part. (when katie was shown in the closit)The cast was great! Sarah's performed was spectacular and was VERY freaked out by the woman. And check out the unrated version of the grudge, it contains more scary images that wast shon in the movies and wont be show in the original DVD, so i would recommend the unrated version if u want to scream more.

The Grudge is about a house that isn't a very happy place to be. People die or disappear (of course!) and no one seems to know exactly why or how to avoid getting caught up in its secrets. There are a number of flashbacks provided to catch the audience up on past events, so fret not. This isn't a movie you will walk out of with a lot of questions, save one, "Why do people in horror movies automatically lose IQ points?" The answer to that is simple: If characters in horror movies were smart, there'd be no story. The plot is standard, but well-done. The characters are driven and as dense as they should be, considering this is a horror movie. The sound is expertly used to enhance the tension, as it should be, by underlying the scenes, rather than drive or create the tension. Any horror movie watcher is bound to be pleased by this fun, suspenseful story. The graphics were on par, and there's a number of very nice surprises with them. All in all, a great release for the 2004 Halloween season and I think it will do very well.

wow...I just saw this with my friend after work tonight, and we were literally holding onto each other we were so scared. A couple people actually left the theatre because they were too scared, and I actually screamed outloud a couple times. It is sort of a puzzle-like movie, you really have to pay attention and piece it together as the movie progresses, but it is interesting how everything fits together. At some points I feel they could have explained a little more, but overall, it was good. If I ever hear clicking noises like the ones in the movie, I will pee my pants. This one is Definitely NOT for kids...If you want to be scared, go see this movie.

Out of all of the scary movies I have ever seen, i would have to say that this, by far, was definitely the best! It kept me on the edge of my seat from the very beginning to the end. I have never screamed during any movie(ever)and now my voice is fading because I screamed so much. I was terrified, and I loved it! Overall one of the best movies I have ever seen, and I can't wait to watch it again, and I definitely will. If you think The Ring was good, you'll love The Grudge. It was great trying to figure out exactly what was going on in the movie and I personally love movies that mess with my mind, and I love trying to uncover the mystery behind it all. This is a definite must see for everyone!!!!

Review title: Scariest movie I have ever seen.
Review_body: I can't even find the words to explain how scary this movie was. I've never done any more than jumped a little when something flashed across the screen but this movie had me shaking and pressed into my seat. One of the girls I was with "went to the bathroom" and didn't come back for the rest of the movie after seeing one scene. The girls face is the scariest thing I've ever witnessed in my life. If anyone called me right now and started with that noise she makes I think I'd be traumatized for life. Everything they did in this movie was perfect. Even if you know something is coming, it still scares the heck out of you. This makes the ring look like a Disney movie. I HIGHLY recommend this movie to anyone.

well what can i say about that movie...hmmm.... it was the dumbest movie! it was even worse than the village and thats pretty bad! i would not recommend it! it wasn't even scary or anything like it was suppose to be. when i went it was soooo packed cuz it was suppose to be sooo good, and at the "scary parts" everyone laughed cuz it was soooooooooooo fake!! what the heck?? it was gay!!!!!!!! the plot was dumb too and whats up with the Japanese people in it????!!!!!!!!!!?!?!? I HATED THAT MOVIE!! it was a waste of money i can tell ya that. it could of been a lot better if it was actually realistic which it wasn't. i wonder how many ppl actually liked it?! i fell asleep for like 10 mins cuz it was so boring

i am a big fanatic of horror movies. at the theaters, they are always my first choice. i love them even though they put so many thoughts into my head. well, of ALL horror movies that i have seen, The Grudge is most definitely The BEST i have ever seen. i have never screamed like i did during the movie. as is, i never scream and i get annoyed when others did, but now i have no reason to get mad...i am a screamer too. even out of the theatre, my friend didn't even attempt to, and yet he scared the crap out of me because of an image from the movie. this movie i can definitely see over and over again, and it will still have me screaming.

OK when I saw the previews for this movie I thought it looked really scary and was quite excited to see it as were the group I was with. Now living in America especially during this election I see some very deceiving things but I have to say these previews were towards the top of list. I don't see how so many people could be scared by this movie. I only really noticed two real jump scenes and only jumped at one. The whole movie was extremely predictable and perhaps that messed up some of the jump scenes for me. As for the sound effects so many to be so frightened of I thought they were comical at best. Oh and the uhh catboy where did that come from and why? The worst noise in the whole movie had to be the weird groaning. How does that scare someone? I can make that noise easily. Now don't get me wrong I have always loved all those really bad scary movies that your just laughing the whole way through but I didn't even think this one had that going for it it was just plain out bad.

Review title: it will make you jump but so what?
Review_body: Sure this movie had a few good scares. I don't mean the kind that haunt your dreams at night well after the movie is over, I simply mean the kind of scare you get when someone jumps out unexpectedly shouting Boo! Big deal. Anyone can do that. This movie lacked the kind of substance it takes to truly scare a person and for that reason it was very disappointing. I guess that happens when American movie execs try to recreate Japanese horror. Making a truly good horror flick is about so much more than weird camera angles and weird noises. Stick to Scream guys, you're much better at it.

Review title: Good movie, so stop your crying
Review_body: So I'm reading through the comments on The Grudge one day, and I'd swear I'm looking at reviews for The Godfather Part 4. This movie was never intended to be solid and plot-hole free. It was never intended to win Oscars or become the next Exorcist phenomenon. It was made to give everyone a little scare for Halloween. I always wonder why these people who hate the movie so much can still write 1000 words about it... I thought it was what it was and did a good job at it. I was impressed that it could keep the tension up for the entire hour and a half and I think that some of the scares were the best I've seen in a LONG time. Some people hated it, said they laughed at it, etc. Well nobody will EVER make a movie that scares everyone. It's impossible. I am much more likely to be freaked out by ghost movies than I ever will by a stalker movie. A lot of people feel the exact opposite. I'm not going to say The Grudge was the best horror movie of all time, but I will say that if you're one to be more frightened by the supernatural then the knife-wielding psychopath, there's a good chance that you'll find this movie frightening and very entertaining, I did. And for all you self-proclaimed horror movie geniuses, who rip all these movies with your tough-guy, I ain't scared of nothing' attitudes...stop your crying.

This was right up my alley for a horror movie. You don't need slashing, blood and guts to scare the Hell out of people. This definitely did it for me. I'm a die-hard horror movie fan and this is one of the scariest - in my opinion - in that genre.Sarah Michelle Gellar (as well as ALL the other cast members) did a great job in her role. The audience was full when I went to see this (predominantly male) and I have never heard nor seen so many men scream and jump throughout a movie. It was also fast paced (versus the Ring) and it kept you on the edge of your seat constantly. The Ring was my favorite before this, but I have to say it will have to a close backseat after watching The Grudge. Just Awesome...

Review title: Nearly a complete waste of time
Review_body: This isn't a movie, it's a sample reel. Lots of scary scenes, lots of interesting special effects. It has an overall creepy feel to it but no story, no character development, and no ending. It just goes creepily along for a while and then suddenly stops.Yes, there are some scary moments. And some totally pointless ones... like, when Kare is in the shower. What the heck is that thing on the back of her head? What does it have to do with anything else in the movie? Yeah, it's creepy. Yeah, it's startling. But does it help the plot? Does it develop the character? It's just a pointless "Boo!"The whole movie goes along like that. You get lots of shocks and "Wow, what was that?" moments, but you never learn anything substantive about the people and ghosts who make up this story. You are never given any reason to care what happens to them. And in the end, nothing is resolved.

I went in not expecting much, I came out with less. EVERYTHING IS PREDICTABLE. .. OH MY GOD "the music is so frightening you KNOW something is going to happen, LET ME CLOSE MY EYES AND COVER MY FACE because I don't want to see it".. Nah. This movie was a disappointment; I felt they wasted my time and money. The movie wasn't horribly bad until the last scene were you saw that the writer/director struggled with the end of the movie not knowing quite how to mesh this mess into an actual story plot. Then we will see if the writer/director has had a nice long vacation and gotten rid of his WRITERS BLOCK.Movies are there to critic, Leslie M

Review title: Simply awful and insipid. I hate stupid movies.
Review_body: Imagine that you are asked by your date what movie you wanted to see, and you remember seeing a rather intriguing trailer about "The Grudge." So, in good faith, you recommend seeing that movie. It is the Halloween season, after all. And it did boffo box office this past weekend, so it must be pretty good...so you go.And you're actually in a state of shock when the movie ends the way it does, and you hear yourself audibly saying, "that can't be the end of the movie...." But, alas, it is. And imagine coming out of the movie theater being embarrassed and ashamed for recommending such a dog of a movie. You think that your date thinks you're a bonehead for suggesting such an atrocity, and your suggestion will certainly end a promising relationship. Actually, it was so bad that both of us cracked up laughing at how bad it was. I see no future for Miss Gellar in the movies, and suggest that she sticks to television in the future. Actually, it won't be long before she is consigned to flea-market conventions selling Buffy memorabilia, and it can't happen soon enough, if you ask me. Horrible, horrible, horrible. The plot didn't make sense; continuity was terrible. It's apparent that the whole ending was contrived to have a "Grudge II--The Return of 'Cat-Boy'."

Review title: I thought it would be scarier!
Review_body: I have to say, if I can keep my eyes open during a scary movie - it isn't that scary. I found myself feeling REALLY bad for the little boy...I don't quite understand what happened to him. Did the Dad drown him too? Was he already dead when Bill Pullman showed up at the house? I would guess so. In addition, I thought the movie didn't flow well at all. To much retrospective to current views. I was quite impressed with the horrifying make-up. I did laugh though when Yoko was walking into the Care Center and there was blood dripping everywhere. The person I was with said - Wow, she must have really gotten her period bad!!! Anyway - I gave it a 5 out of 10. The Exorcist...now THAT's a scary movie!

Review title: Grudge delivers extra scares for Halloween
Review_body: I was excited about seeing The Grudge. The previews scared me enough and with anticipation I took my dad one Saturday to our local theater, joining a large group in the theater. My dad and I never scare. We laughed at Dawn of the Dead and snickered during the Exorist, however there was utter silence through the entire 96 minutes.If the beginning doesn't make you jump you may be dead yourself and while some claim there is no plot I say: What do you want from a horror movie? This isn't Troy or Gladiator, this is a downright scary movie made to keep you on the edge of your seat or place your hands over your eyes.The normal rules of typical haunted house movies don't apply and the usual hack and slash is non-existent, leading way for a creepy, dark atmosphere. I urge you all to see this film, and take a friend, you won't be disappointed.

Review title: After only 5 minutes I wondered if this was a bad idea.
Review_body: This film is certainly shallow, there is very little in plot or character progression. You never really care about any of the people involved, and you know how each scene containing a solitary character will eventually end.But, this is still the most terrifying film I've ever seen.This is the product of a very warped mind. It's purity of purpose is astonishing, as is how effective it is in completing that task. It is there to scare, and nothing else. The whole film is just one frightening set piece after another, from start to finish.Well done!p.s. Ending was excellent.

The Grudge , Not bad the only problems were a few holes in the character and plot development. Overall if you liked the ring you'll love the grudge. but if you want something more you should go see "SAW". The grudge has tried to americanize itself and for that i applaud. The next one just needs to work slightly better on the character backstories. The world loves when we start to get to know a character and feel like they are a friend of the family and bam a dark mysterious stranger rips their heads off. We as a audience need to feel like we know the victim to get sucked in the movie and feel like were part of it. That is the best way to scare the living hell out of people.

This move is perfect for the halloween spirit. If you are going to the movies and want to watch a scary movie this is the one. You have to watch the movie under one condition....DON'T EXPECT A PLOT. This movie kept me on the edge of my seat. It was full of those startling moments that make you jump. Of course there is no plot and of course you are going to say that the ending was less than perfect but at least you will get a good scare. Most horror movies lack plots, but are good for a scare. Horror movies are meant to scare you and this one will. It is nice having a horror movie that doesn't involve some physchopath trying to kill everyone for revenge. If you are looking for a scare and not a masterpiece watch this movie.

Review title: I now have a grudge against Sam Raimi
Review_body: I saw this last night. I went in prepared to be scared, or at least chilled. Instead I was totally disappointed and ended up laughing more than gripping the armrest. I'm really surprised by all the positive comments people are leaving. To each his own, but the movie I saw sucked so bad I have hickeys all over me. I guess I'm one of those wacky folks that wants a story to go along with the creepy music and spooky tar-mouthed baby ghosts. Otherwise it's just not scary or interesting. First of all I had a really hard time caring about the deaths (or lives) of any of the cardboard characters in the movie. I know that's not generally the point in a horror movie, but this is no slasher flick - it's in that "art/horror" genre where there's usually a little bit of character development. None to be had here. Didn't give a crap about the idiot sister hiding under the covers or anyone in her family or Sarah Michelle Gellar's wet-noodle boyfriend. (SMG did a great job with what she was given, but I would really love to see her use her talent in a good movie next time).And I'm all for suspension of disbelief, but if you're going to spend the time to come up with plot developments, then I really think you should resolve them somehow. Case in point: (Spoiler) The jaw of the caretaker Yoko was removed by the dead woman. Why? Oh, no reason. It just was. Oooh scary...And I wonder if the story line about Bill Pullman could have been any more vague and one dimensional. And why was his wife dressed like a drag queen when SMG goes to visit her? But the worst problem with the plot is the heart of it.(Spoiler) Any person who dies in a fit of rage causes others to die in that same place. Now, let's think about this for a second. Wasn't the HUSBAND the one in the fit of rage? Not the wife, not the creepy little boy. The wife was the cheater and the one who betrayed her spouse. She was probably terrified and not thrilled about getting murdered, but it doesn't make sense to say she was in a fit of rage. She was the victim. So why is she the one coming back to kill? It doesn't make any sense. Also, the plot was just boring. We're told that anyone who goes in the house dies. Then they all do in fact die. No contrast, no challenge. Just a bland carte blanche death sentence to all who enter the house. Blah.The movie a had a few good points. Some suspenseful moments, etc. But all in all, I and my friends (who are easily frightened) were pretty annoyed by the movie. I think the girl in the back of the theater last night pretty much summed it up when after the last scene she yelled, "Oh HAYL no!"It was that bad.

This movie was horrible. It was like the spooky girl from The Ring turned Japanese and haunted a house that she died in. This movie drug out and besides maybe jumping a few times, I felt I could have done a better job at playing this one out. It seems as though they had a good story but there was probably so much more that could have been done with it. Seemed like there were bits a pieces of good information that was left out of this movie. If you REALLY liked The Ring then I guess you will like this. Otherwise don't waste your money here. Go rent the Omen or Amityville horror. Go see SAW. Go see SAW. Go see SAW. Go see SAW. Go see SAW. Or whatever other movie is your second choice.

Review title: The scarest movie I have seen in a long time!
Review_body: This movie kept me up and awake all night after I saw it. I slept with the lights on for the next week but It is well worth it. If you are willing to get the holy hell scared out of you then you will love this movie. You have to be ready for at any time something to pop up.
